questions.text: a) In Data Organization and retrieval applications, data structures plays an important role. 5 Define data structure and illustrate the classification of data structure with examples. b) Develop a program in java to read a sparse matrix of integer values in the 2D array format 10 and convert the sparse matrix to <row, column, value> format and search for an element specified by the user. Print the result of the search appropriately. c) Develop a program in java to multiply one matrix with another, and need to check first, if 10 the number of columns of the first matrix is equal to the number of rows of the second matrix. Now multiply each element of the column of the first matrix with each element of rows of the second matrix and add them all. OR

a) Random number generators has its application in many fields such as cryptography, 8 statistics, etc. Generate 10 random elements using random class methods. Apply the sorting algorithm which works for application of playing cards and sort it. b) Define an array. Discuss the types of array. Give the syntax of One Dimensional Array 7 declaration and illustrate the creation of an array in java programming. c) Programmers might prefer to store the data in continuous memory locations in order to 10 improve the efficiency of program. Define and write the syntax and the instantiation of the data structure that can be used. Using the same, write a java program to find the second largest and second smallest element of ‘n’ integer elements. UNIT – II

a) Define Circular Singly Linked List. Develop a program in java to implement following operation of Circular Singly Linked List 10 i) addFirst( ) ii) addLast() iii) addBeforeKey() iv) display() b) Consider the below list, 10 Identify and write the appropriate function to perform the below operations. i) Remove the key=75 from the list. ii)Make the node with the key 45 and address 150 to be the first node. iii) Add the node with key 70 and address 230 before the key 75. c) Differentiate between Singly linked List, Circular Singly Linked List and Doubly Linked 5 List. OR

a) Define Singly Linked List. List out the advantages, applications of Singly Linked List 5 and also list out the drawbacks of array. Page 1 of 2 b) Consider a class having 100 students where, the details of each student like name, roll 10 number and marks of 3 subjects are to be stored. Develop a program to construct a singly linked list to enter records of different students in list, display the list and calculate the percentage of each student. Also display the total number of students passed (scored >40 in all the subjects). c) Construct a java program to perform the below functions on doubly linked List i) addAfterKey( ) ii) removeKey( ) iii) addAtPosition( ) iv) display( ) 10 UNIT – III 5 a) Write a java program to implement Queue data structure using singly linked list 10 b) Explain how the Queue can be used to check whether a string is palindrome or not. Also 5 write a java program that does the same. c) Evaluate the following postfix expressions using stack data structure. 10 i) 5 3 + 6 2 / * 3 5 * + ii) 7 6 2 + * 42 / - Also write a java program to implement the same. OR 6 a) Explain how the stack can be used to check whether a string is palindrome or not. Also 5 write a java program that does the same. b) Convert the following infix expressions into postfix form using stack. i) (a+b/c*(d+c)-f) ii) (a+b*c)/((d+e)*f)/g+h 10 Also write a java program to implement the same c) Write a java program to implement Stack data structure using singly linked list 10 UNIT-IV

a) Construct a binary search tree for the sequence of numbers 12,15,5,9,1,3,20,17,19,2,4,16. 10 Write a java program to perform In order, Pre order and Post order traversal of the binary search tree constructed. b) Given In-order and Post order traversal In Order: 3,12,6,4,7,10,11,5,2,8 Post Order: 5 3,6,7,4,12,11,8,2,5,10. Construct a binary search Tree. c) Define Tree abstract data type. List the properties of tree. Also develop a JAVA source 10 code to construct the BST and to traverse the same using In order, Post order and Pre order traversal. OR

a) Illustrate i) Binary Tree ii) Binary Search Tree iii) Complete Binary Tree with examples 6 b) Files are stored in memory in tree structure directory. Design and develop a program to 10 create a directory having files with unique file-id in the hard disk and display the files in all three traversal orders using Binary Search Tree (BST). c) The binary tree is a nonlinear data structure. Data in a tree is represent in a hierarchical 9 manner. Determine the in-order, pre-order, and post- order traversals of the given binary tree with steps. *** Page 2 of 2 SRN 3rd Semester B.Tech CSE Semester End Examination June 2023
